subject: Re: [junit] Object comparison using assertEquals
msgSnippet: Perhaps I am having a brain freeze this morning, but isn t equal by reference a == b?  Assert.assertEquals(Object o1, Object o2) does an equals(Object)...
messageBody:
Perhaps I am having a brain freeze this morning, but isn't 'equal by
reference' a == b? Assert.assertEquals(Object o1, Object o2) does an
equals(Object)...

=jason

On Tue, 2003-05-20 at 00:52, kartikdg wrote:
> Hi,
> I would like to deep compare 2 objects (expectedResult and
> actualResult)
> using JUnit.
>
> JUnit provides an interface called assertEquals(Object o1, Object o2)
> which compares 2 obects by reference and does not perform a deep
> comparison.
>
> Since the expectedResult and actualResult will never have the same
> reference, does anyone have any idea on how to perform a deep
> comparison comparing the values of 2 objects) ?
>
> Cheers
> Kartik
>
>
